Definition: You will be shown a protein. Your job is to describe {Biological Summary}, and this protein should be {Relationship Summary}. {Task-Specific Relationship}
Task-Specific Relationship: A target of a drug is a protein that the drug binds to, resulting in an alteration of the normal function of the bound molecule and a desirable therapeutic effect. Drug targets are most commonly proteins such as enzymes, ion channels, and receptors
